explanation: The report is correct. The for header declares and initializes the loop counter i (for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)), but the loop body also increments i in multiple places (several ++i occurrences and an explicit ++i in the else branch). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires that the loop counter shall not be modified in the body of the for loop (the third clause must be the only place that modifies the loop counter). Modifying i inside the body therefore makes this for loop ill‑formed under Rule 14.2. To fix this, restructure the code so the loop counter is only modified by the for third clause (for example use an inner variable for additional advancing, or rewrite the loop as a while loop that explicitly controls the index), or use a separate index variable for inner advances.
